newsitem.title: USA: U.S. crafting No. Korean relief effort plan.
newsitem.headline: U.S. crafting No. Korean relief effort plan.

text.p: The U.S. military has held preliminary talks designed to launch an international relief effort in the event North Korea's communist regime collapses, the Wall Street Journal said.

In Thursday's electronic edition, the Journal quoted an unnamed Defence Department official as saying that the United States has held talks with South Korea and Japan and has had some "very general discussions" with China.

The efforts focus on what to do if large numbers of hungry refugees in food-short North Korea seek to flee. U.S. diplomats and military officials also are trying to figure out how to best get large quantities of food and medicine into North Korea quickly.
The situation is delicate as the U.S. military tries to find a way to conduct the relief effort and still limit its ground involvement inside North Korea so that its intentions are not misconstrued.

"While it's not always smart to talk about hypothetical situations, you'd have to be fat, dumb and blind to not know that the North Koreans are suffering from a fuel and food problem," Marine Major General Frank Libutti said.
